page.title: 02Kielder Castle
page.content:
{Kielder Castle}was built in 1775 as a Hunting-lodge for Hugh,1st Duke of Northumberland. In 1930 it was purchased by the Forestry Commission, along with 19,000 hectares of land, which now forms the main block of the Kielder Forest. For many years the castle was a Working Men's Club, intended for the foresters.
Now Kielder Castle is the Commission's Information Centre, and provides visitors with displays and exhibits which show the history of the forest and the cycle of work which is necessary to maintain and develop it. The Centre is open from Easter to September.
